designScenario.name: Oxygen System
designScenario.description: The Oxygen System is a critical safety system designed to provide breathable oxygen to passengers and crew during cabin decompression events or loss of cabin pressure. It integrates chemical oxygen generators, distribution networks, and mask deployment mechanisms to ensure rapid oxygen supply. The system is engineered for high reliability, fail-safe operation, and compliance with aviation safety regulations (e.g., FAA, EASA). It operates in tandem with the Environmental Control System to monitor cabin altitude and trigger emergency oxygen deployment when thresholds are exceeded.

details.description: The system shall generate breathable oxygen via chemical oxygen generators or stored gaseous oxygen, activated automatically during cabin depressurization.
Automatically deploy passenger and crew oxygen masks within 5 seconds of cabin altitude exceeding 14,000 feet.
Deliver a minimum oxygen flow rate of 2.4 liters per minute per passenger mask for at least 15 minutes.
Implement dual redundant activation pathways (electrical and mechanical) to ensure mask deployment under all failure conditions.
Provide real-time oxygen system status and fault diagnostics to the cockpit crew via the central Environmental Control System interface.

systemComponents.name: Oxygen Generators
systemComponents.description: Chemical or gaseous oxygen sources that produce breathable oxygen upon activation.

subComponents.name: Chemical Oxygen Canisters
subComponents.description: Sodium chlorate-based generators activated by pyrotechnic charges during decompression.

subComponents.name: Activation Mechanism
subComponents.description: Electromechanical trigger initiating oxygen generation via thermal decomposition.

subComponents.name: Oxygen Purity Sensor
subComponents.description: Monitors O2 concentration in generated gas to ensure ≥99% purity.

systemComponents.name: Distribution Network
systemComponents.description: Ducting and valves regulating oxygen flow from generators to masks.

subComponents.name: Oxygen Ducts
subComponents.description: Fire-resistant polymer conduits distributing oxygen to mask assemblies.

subComponents.name: Flow Control Valves
subComponents.description: Electropneumatic valves modulating oxygen pressure and flow rates.

subComponents.name: Pressure Regulator
subComponents.description: Maintains 4-6 psi outlet pressure for mask delivery systems.

systemComponents.name: Masks Deployment System
systemComponents.description: Mechanism storing and releasing passenger/crew oxygen masks.

subComponents.name: Mask Assemblies
subComponents.description: Oxygen masks with rebreather bags and elastic lanyards.

subComponents.name: Release Mechanism
subComponents.description: Spring-loaded panel doors activated by cabin altitude sensors.

subComponents.name: Lanyard Sensor
subComponents.description: Detects mask pull-to-activate action to initiate oxygen flow.

systemComponents.name: Oxygen Monitoring System
systemComponents.description: Sensors and controllers tracking oxygen system status.

subComponents.name: Cabin Altitude Sensor
subComponents.description: Barometric sensor triggering deployment at 14,000 ft cabin altitude.

subComponents.name: Oxygen Pressure Sensor
subComponents.description: Measures line pressure in distribution network.

systemComponents.name: Oxygen Control Unit
systemComponents.description: Central processor managing activation thresholds and crew alerts.

subComponents.name: Fault Detection Circuit
subComponents.description: Continuous built-in-test (BIT) of oxygen system components.

subComponents.name: Crew Alerting Panel
subComponents.description: Visual/aural warnings for low oxygen pressure or generator faults.

relationships.description: The Control Unit aggregates pressure and altitude data from the Monitoring System to determine deployment timing.
The Distribution Network depends on oxygen supply from Generators during emergency operations.
The Deployment System is composed of Release Mechanisms integrated into overhead panel assemblies.
The Monitoring System transmits real-time sensor data to the Control Unit via CAN bus.
Oxygen ducts interface with mask lanyards to supply oxygen when masks are deployed.
The Oxygen System relies on cabin altitude data from the Environmental Control System's pressure sensors.

attributes.name: oxygenFlowRate
attributes.description: Guaranteed oxygen flow rate per mask under decompression conditions.

attributes.name: deploymentAltitude
attributes.description: Cabin altitude threshold for automatic mask deployment.

attributes.name: responseTime
attributes.description: Maximum allowable delay between altitude threshold breach and mask deployment.

attributes.name: oxygenCapacity
attributes.description: Minimum duration of oxygen supply at maximum flow rate.

attributes.name: operatingPressure
attributes.description: Regulated oxygen pressure at mask interface.

attributes.name: oxygenPurity
attributes.description: Minimum oxygen concentration in delivered gas mixture.

comments.body: Primary oxygen delivery system for crew and passengers meeting FAA 14 CFR 25.1441 requirements
